Hi folks. I think is called the release header. Where is it configurable? I have one that says 'Local build' but want to change that. Thanks! (the below pic is not mine, just an example) @Jenny Thompson
Screen-Shot-2021-07-22-at-17.38.30.png
that is part of the HL7 publication process... up in the tower...
It will be changed as part of the publication process - you don't need to worry about that bit.
I have an issue with that - I presume it's the same issue mentioned
when we run our own CI build, it simply says "..... Local Development build (v0.2.0). See the Directory of published versions"
Yes, @Jose Costa Teixeira it's for ddcc.

I do think that for outside publishers, it would be good to get clear guidance.
As to the pointer to github, I just put that in the narrative on the index page. It is a hack. I would prefer we could look similar to HL7 for the sake of all our readers.

Another issue with this box: if the IG hasn't been published by HL7 yet, the "directory of published versions" link is broken. I ended up hiding the box with CSS up until we made the ballot-ready version of our IG as this was confusing people.

(We also have "&" in our IG title and it is rendered as "&" in the publish box (GitHub issue).)
